alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Mayes; Muskogee; Sequoyah; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Sequoyah, southeastern Mayes, southwestern Adair, southeastern Wagoner, Cherokee and northeastern Muskogee Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 200 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles west of Scraper to 4 miles southwest of Tahlequah to 4 miles northwest of Pumpkin Center. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Tahlequah... Wagoner... Stilwell... Fort Gibson... Okay... Hulbert... Marble City... Eldon... Proctor... Peggs... Pumpkin Center... Maryetta... Cookson... Cherokee Landing State Park... Bunch... Sequoyah State Park... Lake Tenkiller State Park... Box... Lost City... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Cherokee; Mayes; Muskogee; Sequoyah; Wagoner
